content: Compile and Link function prototypes(å£°æ˜) & definitiones: function prototypes normally are put into head files (*.h, *.hpp) int mul(int a, int b); function definitiones normally are in source files (*.c, *.cpp) int mul(int a, int b) { return a * b; } Separate the sorce code into multiple files: // main.cpp #include <iostream> #include "mul.hpp" using namespace std; int main() { int a, b; int result; cout << "Pick two integers:"; cin >> a; cin >> b; result = mul(a, b); cout << "The result is " << result << endl; return 0; } // mul.hpp #pragma once int mul(int a, int b); // mul.cpp #include "mul.hpp" int mul(int a, int b) { return a * b; } è¦ç”Ÿæˆå¯æ‰§è¡Œæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œåº”å½“æ‰§è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹å‘½ä»¤ï¼š # å¯¹æºæ–‡ä»¶è¿›è¡Œç¼–è¯‘ g++ -c main.cpp # ç”Ÿæˆç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶mian.o g++ -c mul.cpp # ç”Ÿæˆç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶mul.o # å¯¹ç›®æ ‡æ–‡ä»¶è¿›è¡Œé“¾æ¥ g++ main.o mul.o -o mul # ç”Ÿæˆå¯æ‰§è¡Œæ–‡ä»¶mul Debug Compilation errors Normally caused by grammar error Check the source code Link errors â€œSymbol not foundâ€ Function misspelled Runtime errors The source code can successfully compiled and linked The floating point exception (divided by 0) will kill the program It is a typical runtime error

content: Preprocessor and Macros(å®) Preprocessor The preprocessor is excuted before the compilation Preprocessing directives(é¢„å¤„ç†æŒ‡ä»¤) begin with a # character Each directive occupies one line Preprocessing instruction (define, undef, include, if, ifdef, ifndef, else, elif, endif, line, error, pragma) Include directive åŸæ–‡ä»¶ï¼š #include "mul.hpp" int main(){} ç»è¿‡é¢„å¤„ç†å™¨é¢„å¤„ç†å¾—åˆ°ï¼š int mul(int a, int b); int main(){} Macros(#define) åŸæ–‡ä»¶ï¼š #define PI 3.14 double len(double r) { return 2.0 * PI * r; } ç»è¿‡é¢„å¤„ç†å™¨é¢„å¤„ç†å¾—åˆ°ï¼š double len(double r) { return 2.0 * 3.14 * r; }

content: Simple Output and Input C++ Style Output What is cout? std::ostream cout; cout is an object of data type ostream in namespace std. cout << "hello" << endl; << is an operator which is defined as follows basic_ostream& operator<<( short value ); ... endl, an output-only I/O manipulator. It will output a new line character and flushes. C++ Style Input Similarly, cin is an object of type std::istream >> is an operator C Style Output int v = 100; printf("Hello, value = %d\n", v); int printf( const char *format, ... ); is a function format: a string specifying how to interpret the data %d will let the function interpret v as an integer C Style Input int v; int ret = scanf("%d", &v); scanf reads data from stdin, and interrpret the input as an integer and store it into v Command line arguments #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main(int argc, char** argv) { for (int i = 0; i < argc; i++) { cout << i << ": " << argv[i] << endl; } return 0; } argcæ˜¯arugment countçš„ç¼©å†™ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºä¼ å…¥mainå‡½æ•°çš„å‚æ•°ä¸ªæ•°ã€‚argvæ˜¯argument vectorçš„ç¼©å†™ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºä¼ å…¥mainå‡½æ•°çš„å‚æ•°åºåˆ—æˆ–æŒ‡é’ˆï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°argv[0]æ˜¯åŒ…å«è·¯å¾„çš„ç¨‹åºåç§°ã€‚

content: Integer Numbers int int is the most frequently used integer type Initialization Uninitialized variables may have random values. The behavior depends on the compiler. #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int num1; int num2; cout << "num1 = " << num1 << endl; cout << "num2 = " << num2 << endl; return 0; } // num1 = 32767 // num2 = -137238492 Clang(x86_64)è¡¨ç°ä¸ºéšæœºå€¼ï¼ŒClang(arm64)è¡¨ç°ä¸º0 How to initialize int num; num = 10; int num = 10; int num (10); int num {10} Overflow int a = 789789; int b = 789987; int c = a * b; cout << "c = " << c << endl; // c = -1069976775 The correct result is 0xC0397339, the sign bit is 1 signed and unsigned unsignedæ²¡æœ‰ç¬¦å·ä½ï¼Œ32ä½å…¨éƒ¨ä¿å­˜æ­£æ•°ã€‚ signed int can be shorten as int. Its range is [-2^31, 2^31 - 1] if itâ€™s 32-bit unsigned int: Its range is [0, 2^32 - 1] if itâ€™s 32-bit Different Data Types for Integer use long int for longer integers use short int for shorter integers and long long C and C++ standards do not fix the widths of them sizeof opertor can return the width in bytes. sizeof It is a operator, not a function #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int i = 0; short s = 0; cout << "sizeof(int) = " << sizeof(int) << endl; cout << "sizeof(i) = " << sizeof(i) << endl; cout << "sizeof(short) = " << sizeof(short) << endl; cout << "sizeof(long) = " << sizeof(long) << endl; cout << "sizeof(size_t) = " << sizeof(size_t) << endl; } // sizeof(int) = 4 // é•¿åº¦ä¸º4ä¸ªå­—èŠ‚ // sizeof(i) = 4 // sizeof(short) = 2 // sizeof(long) = 8 // sizeof(size_t) = 8 å‡½æ•°çš„å‚æ•°å¿…é¡»æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå˜é‡ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯sizeof(int)ä¸­çš„intä¸æ˜¯å˜é‡ï¼Œå› æ­¤sizeofæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ“ä½œç¬¦

content: More Integer Types char char: type for character, 8-bit integer indeed signed char: signed 8-bit integer unsigned char: unsigned 8-bit integer char: either signed char or unsignede char Integers and characters How we represent a character? use an 8-bit integer use an 16-bit or 32-bit integer (Chinese characters) #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { char c1 = 'C'; char c2 = 80; char c3 = 0x50; char16_t c4 = u'äº'; char32_t c5 = U'äº'; cout << c1 << ":" << c2 << ":" << c3 << endl; // æ·»åŠ +ä½¿c1ã€c2ã€c3ä»¥æ•´æ•°çš„å½¢å¼æ‰“å°å‡ºæ¥ cout << +c1 << ":" << +c2 << ":" << +c3 << endl; cout << c4 << endl; cout << c5 <<endl; } // C:P:P // 67:80:80 // 20110 // 20110 bool A C++ keyword, but not a C keyword bool width: 1 byte (8 bit), NOT 1 bit Value: true (1) or false (0) #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { bool b1 = true; int i = b1; bool b2 = -256; // boolç±»å‹ä¸ä¸ºé›¶å‡ä¸ºtrue cout << "i = " << i << endl; cout << "b1 = " << b1 << endl; cout << "b2 = " << b2 << endl; } // i = 1 // b1 = 1 // b2 = 1 Boolean in C Use typedef to create a type typedef char bool; #define true 1 #define false 0 Defined in stdbool.h since C99 #include <stdbool.h> size_t Computer memory keeps increasing 32-bit int was enough in the past to for data length But now it is not size_t: Unsigned integer Type of the result of sizeof operator Can store the maximum size of theoretically possible object of any type 32-bit or 64-bit Fixed width integer types(since C++11) Defined in <cstdint>: int8_t, int16_t, int32_t, int64_t, uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t, uint64_t, â€¦ and some useful macros: INT8_MIN, INT16_MIN, INT32_MIN, INT64_MIN, INT8_MAX, INT16_MAX, INT32_MAX, INT64_MAX, â€¦
title: C/C++ç¨‹åºè®¾è®¡

content: Floating-point Numbers float #include <iostream> #include <iomanip> using namespace std; int main() { float f1 = 1.2f; // fæ„å‘³è¯¥æ•°ä¸ºfloatå‹ï¼Œå¦åˆ™ä¸ºdouble float f2 = f1 * 1e15; cout << fixed << setprecision(15) << f1 << endl; // setprecisionè®¾å®šæœ‰æ•ˆä½ cout << fixed << setprecision(15) << f2 << endl; return 0; } // 1.200000047683716 // 1200000038076416.000000000000000 You want 1.2, but float can only provide you 1.200000047683716â€¦ Floating-point operations always bring some tiny errors, those errors cannot be eliminated What can we do: to manage them not to cause a problem Floating-point types float: single precision floating-point type, 32 bits double: double precision floating-point type, 64 bits long double: extended precision floating-point type 128 bits if supported 64 bits otherwise half precision floating-point, 16 bits used in deep learning, but not a C++ standard Floating-point VS integer Represent values between integers A much greater range of values Floating-point operations are slower than integer operations Lose precision double operations is slower than float Precision #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { float f1 = 2.34e10f; float f2 = f1 + 10; // fixed-pointå®šç‚¹æ•°ï¼Œå°æ•°ç‚¹åä½æ•°å›ºå®š cout.setf(ios_base::fixed, ios_base::floatfield); cout << "f1 = " << f1 << endl; cout << "f2 = " << f2 << endl; cout << "f1 - f2 = " << f1 - f2 << endl; cout << "(f1 - f2 == 0) = " << (f1 - f2 == 0) << endl; return 0; } // f1 = 23399999488.000000 // f2 = 23399999488.000000 // f1 - f2 = 0.000000 // (f1 - f2 == 0) = 1 Can we use == operator to compare two floating point numbers? if (f1 == f2) // bad if (fabs(f1 - f2) < FLT_EPSILON) // good inf and nan inf: infinity nan: not a number
title: C/C++ç¨‹åºè®¾è®¡

content: Arithmetic Operators(ç®—æœ¯è¿ç®—) Constant numer 95 // decimal 0137 // octal å‰åŠ 0è¡¨ç¤º8è¿›åˆ¶ 0x5f // hexadecimal å‰åŠ 0xè¡¨ç¤º16è¿›åˆ¶ 95 // int 95u // unsigned int 95l // long 95ul // unsigned long 95lu // unsigned long 3.14159 // 3.14159 6.02e23 // 6.02 * 10^23 1.6e-19 // 1.6 * 10^-19 3.0 // 3.0 6.02e23L // long double 6.02e23f // float 6.02e23 // double Const type qualifier(const é™å®šç¬¦) const float PI = 3.1415926f; PI += 1; // error If a variable/object is constant-qualified, it cannot be modified It must be initialized when you define it auto auto is placeholder type specifier The type of variable will be deduced from its initializer auto a = 2; // type of a is int auto b = 2.3; // type of b is double auto c; // valid in C, error in C++ auto d = a * 1.2; // type of d is double a = 2.3; // 2.3 will converted to a int 2, then assigned to a Arithmetic operators Operator name Synatax unary plus +a unary minus -a addition a + b subtraction a - b multiplication a * b division a / b modulo(æ±‚ä½™) a % b bitwise NOT ~a bitwise AND a & b bitwise OR a | b bitwise XOR a ^ b bitwise left shift a Â« b bitwise right shift a Â» b Operator Precdence(ä¼˜å…ˆçº§): a++ ++a * / + - << >> Data type conversions int num_int1 = 9; // assigning an int value to num_int1 int num_int2 = 'C'; // implicit conversion(éšå¼è½¬æ¢) int num_int3 = (int)'C'; // explicit conversion, C-style int num_int4 = int('C'); // explicit conversion, function style int num_int5 = 2.8; // implicit conversion float num_float = 2.3; // implicit conversion from double to float short num_short = 650000; // ä½ä½æˆªæ–­ The source code can be compiled successfully even with warning message when the data types do not match. Please ues expilcit conversion if possible Data loss #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int num_int1 = 0x7ABCDEF0; float num_int_float = num_int1; int num_int2 = (int)num_int_float; cout << "num_int1 = " << num_int1 << endl; cout << "num_int_float = " << num_int_float << endl; cout << "num_int2 = " << num_int2 << endl; return 0; } // num_int1 = 2059198192 // num_int_float = 2.0592e+09 // num_int2 = 2059198208 Division Both operands(æ“ä½œæ•°) are integers Perform integer division Any fractional part of the answer is discarded to make the result an integer float f = 17 / 5; // f will be 3.f, not 3.4f One or both operands are floating-point numbers Perform floating-point division float f = 17 / 5.f; // f will be 3.4f Distinct Operations for Different Types int, long, float, double: four kinds of operations If the operands are not the four types, automatic convert their types unsigned char a = 255; unsigned char b = 1; int c = a + b; // c = 256; The operands will be converted to one of the four types without losing data

content: if Statement Statements are executed conditionally if int num = 10; if (num < 5) { cout << "The number is less than 5. " << endl; } if-else if (num == 5) { cout << "The number is 5. " << endl; } else { cout << "The number is not 5. " << endl; } if-else-if-else if (num < 5) { cout << "The number is less than 5." << endl; } else if (num > 10) { cout << "The number is greater than 5." << endl; } else { cout << "The number is in range [5, 10]. " << endl; } A little more complex if (num < 10) if (num < 5) cout << "The number is less than 5" << endl; else // else ä¸æœ€è¿‘çš„ifè¿›è¡ŒåŒ¹é… cout << "The number is less than 10 and greater than 5" << endl; ? : operator bool isPositive = true; int factor = 0; if (isPositive) { factor = 1; } else { factor = -1; } factor = isPositive ? 1 : -1; facotr = isPositive * 2 - 1;

content: Condition The condition should be an expression which is convertilbe to bool Its value can be bool, int, char, float Relational Expressions The condition can be a relational expression The 6 relational/comparison operators Operator name Example equal to a == b not equal to a != b less than a < b greater than a > b less than and equal to a <= b greater than and equal to a >= b Return 1 if condition is true Return 0 if condition is false Logical Expressions If an operand is not bool, it will be converted to tool implicitly Operator name Symbol-like operator Keyword like operator Example Negation ! not !a AND && and a && b Inclusive OR || or a || b Precedence: ! > && > || Non-Boolean Expressions They will be converted to bool implicitly if it is feasible. float count = 0.2f; // not recommend to use a floating-point number if (count) { // if (count != 0) cout << "There are some. " << endl; } Pointers are also frequently used as conditions int* p = new int[1024]; if (!p) { // if (p == NULL); cout << "Memory allocation failed. " << endl; }

content: while loop Syntax: while (expression) { //... } If the condition is true, the statement (loop body) will be executed. do-while loop The test takes place after iteration in a do-while loop int num = 10; do { cout << "num = " << num << endl; num--; } while (num > 0); break statement Terminate a loop int num = 10; while (num > 10) { if (num == 5) { break; } cout << "num = " << num << endl; num--; } continue statement skip the remianing part of the loop body and continue the next iteration int num = 10; while (num > 10) { if (num == 5) { num--; continue; } cout << "num = " << num << endl; num--; } The Condition, Be Careful! Expression 3 + 4 has a value; Expression a + b has a value; Expression (a == b) has value (true or false); a = b is an assignment, also an expression and has a value (b);

content: for loop Syntax for (init-clause; cond-expression; iteration-expression) { loop-statement; } // Example init sum = 0; for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) { sum += i; cout << "Line " << i << endl; } cout << "sum = " << sum << endl; Endless Loop for (;;) { cout << "Endless Loop!" << endl; } while (true) { cout << "Endless Loop!" << endl; }

content: goto and switch Statement goto Statement Jump to a desired location An unrecommended statement float mysquare(float value) { float result = 0.0f; if (value >= 1.0f || value <= 0) { cerr << "The input is out of range." << endl; goto EXIT_ERROR; } result = value * value; return result; EXIT_ERROR: // do sth such as closing files here return 0.0f; } switch Statement Execute one of several statements, depending on the value of a condition break prevent to excute some following statement More similar with goto, not if-else switch (input_char) { case 'a': case 'A': cout << "Move left." << endl; break; case 'd': case 'D': cout << "Move right." << endl; break; default: cout << "Undifined key." << endl; break; }

content: Array Arrays A contiguously(è¿ç»­çš„) allocated memory Fixed number of object (The array size cannot be changed) Its element type can be any fundamental type (int, float, bool, etc), structure, class, pointer, enumeration(åˆ—ä¸¾) int num_array1[5]; // uninitialized array, random values int num_array2[5] = {0, 1, 2, 3, 4}; // initialization Variable-length arrays If the length is not an integer constant expression, the array will be a variable-length one. æ•°ç»„çš„é•¿åº¦åœ¨ç¼–è¯‘æ—¶ä¸èƒ½ç¡®å®šï¼Œåªæœ‰åœ¨è¿è¡Œçš„æ—¶å€™æ‰å¯ä»¥ç¡®å®š int len = 1; while (len < 10) { int num_array2[len]; // å˜é•¿æ•°ç»„ä¸æ”¯æŒåˆå§‹åŒ– cout << "len = " << len; cout << ", sizeof(num_array2) = " << sizeof(num_array2) << endl; len++; } Array of unknown size The number is not specified in the declaration int num_array[] = {1, 2, 3, 4}; The arguments of a function float array_sum(float values[], size_t length); float array_sum(float *values, size_t length); Element accesssing int array1[4] = {9, 8, 7, 6}; int array2[4]; array2 = array1; // error // arrayçš„å®è´¨æ˜¯æ•°ç»„çš„é¦–åœ°å€ array2[0] = array1[0]; array2[1] = array1[1]; array2[2] = array1[2]; array2[3] = array1[3]; No bounds-checking in C/C++ Arrays are not objects in C/C++, can be regarded as addresses Multidimensional arrays int mat[2][3] = {{11, 12, 13}, {14, 15, 16}}; for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) { for (int c = 0; c < clos; c++) { cout << mat[r][c] << ","; } cout << endl; } // Arrays of unknown bound void init_2d_array(float mat[][], size_t rows, size_t cols); // error void init_2d_array(float mat[][3], size_t rows, size_t cols); const Arrays const float PI = 3.14f; PI += 1.f; // error const float values[4] = {1.0f, 2.0f 3.0f, 4.0f}; values[0] = 1.1f; // error // Used as function arguments float array_sum(const float values[], size_t length) { float sum = 0.0f; for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) { sum += values[i]; // values[i] = 0; // error } return sum; }

content: Strings Array-style strings An array-style string (null-terminated string/arrays of characters) is a series of characters stored in bytes in memory This kind of string can be declared as follows char rabbit[16] = {'P', 'e', 't', 'e', 'r'}; char bad_pig[5] = {'P', 'e', 'p', 'p', 'a'}; // a bad one char good_pig[6] = {'P', 'e', 'p', 'p', 'a', '\0'}; // Returns the number of characters, the first NULL will not be included. size_t strlen(const char* str); char name[10] = {'Y', 'u', '\0', 'S', '.', '0'}; cout << strlen(name) << endl; // 2 String literals(å¸¸é‡å­—ç¬¦ä¸²) It isnâ€™t convenient to initial a string character by character. String literals can help char name1[] = "Southern University of Science and Technology"; char name2[] = "Southern University of " "Science and Technology"; // ä¸ç¬¬ä¸€è¡Œæ²¡æœ‰å·®åˆ«ï¼Œå†™æ³•ä¸ºä¸¤ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦ä¸²çš„è¿æ¥ char name3[] = "ABCD"; const wchar_t s5[] = L"ABCD"; const char16_t s9[] = u"ABCD"; // since C++11 const char32_t s6[] = U"ABCD"; // since C++11 String manipulation(æ“ä½œ) and examination Copy char* strcpy(char* dest, const char* src); // safe one char* strncpy(char* dest, const char* src, size_t count); Concatenate: appends a copy of src to dest char* strcat(char* dest, const char* src); Compare å¦‚æœè¿”å›å€¼å°äº 0ï¼Œåˆ™è¡¨ç¤º lhs å°äº rhsã€‚ å¦‚æœè¿”å›å€¼å¤§äº 0ï¼Œåˆ™è¡¨ç¤º lhs å¤§äº rhsã€‚ å¦‚æœè¿”å›å€¼ç­‰äº 0ï¼Œåˆ™è¡¨ç¤º lhs ç­‰äº rhsã€‚ int strcmp(const char *lhs, const char *rsh); string class Null-terminated string are easy to be out of bound, and to cause problems string class provides functions to manipulate and examinate strings std::string str1 = "Hello"; std::string str2 = "SUSTech"; std::string result = str1 + ", " + str2; cout << "result = " + result << endl; cout << "The length is " << result.length() << endl; cout << "str1 < str2 is " << (str1 < str2) << endl; // cout << "strcmp(str1, str2) = " << strcmp(str1, str2) << endl; Different types of string std::string std::wstring std::u8string // C++20 std::u16string // C++11 std::u32string // C++11 Stringç±»åŒæ ·æ²¡æœ‰è¶Šç•Œæ£€æŸ¥

content: Structures, Unions and Enumerations(æšä¸¾ç±»å‹) struct A struct is a type consisting of a sequence of members The members are allocated in an ordered sequence struct Student { char name[4]; int born; bool male; }; struct Student stu; strcpy(stu.name, "Yu"); stu.born = 2000; stu.male = true; struct Student stu = {"Yu", 2000, true}; struct Student students[100]; students[50].born = 2000; Structure padding In order to align the data in memory, some empty bytes will be padded struct Student1 { int id; bool male; char label; float height; } struct Student2 { int id; bool male; float height; char label; } // size of student1: 12 // size of student2: 16 struct in C and C++ struct and class in C++ are identical(ç›¸åŒ) expect for several features No typedef needed in C++ union union declaration is similar to struct declaration To storage of members overlaps/shared union ipv4address{ std::uint32_t address32; std::uint8_t address8[4]; }; // sizeof(union ipv4address) is 4 // æˆå‘˜é¦–åœ°å€å˜é‡ç›¸åŒ union ipv4address ip; ip.address8[3] = 127; ip.address8[2] = 0; ip.address8[1] = 0; ip.address8[0] = 1; cout << "The address is "; cout << +ip.address8[3] << "."; cout << +ip.address8[2] << "."; cout << +ip.address8[1] << "."; cout << +ip.address8[0] << endl; cout << std::hex; cout << "in hex" << ip.address32 << endl; // The address is 127.0.0.1 // in hex 7f000001 enum enum makes a new type It provides an alternative to const for creating symbolic constants Its members are integers, but they cannot be operands in arithmetic expressions enum color {WHITE, BLACK, RED, GREEN, BLUE, YELLOW, NUM_COLORS}; enum color pen_color = RED; pen_color = color(3); cout << "We have " << NUM_COLORS << " pens." << endl; // We have 6 pens. // pen_color += 1; // error int color_index = pen_color; color_index += 1; cout << "color_index = " << color_index << endl; An example with struct, union and enum enum datatype {TYPE_INT8 = 1, TYPE_INT16 = 2, TYPE_INT32 = 4, TYPE_INIT64 = 8}; struct Point { enum datatype type; union { std::int8_t data8[3]; std::int16_t data16[3]; std::int32_t data32[3]; std::int64_t data64[3]; }; }; size_t datawidth(struct Point pt) { return (size_t)pt.type * 3; } int64_t l1norm(struct Point pt) { int64_t result = 0; switch(pt.type) { case (TYPE_INT8): result = abs(pt.data8[0]) + abs(pt.data8[1]) + abs(pt.data8[2]); break; ... } } // declaration and initialization struct Point point1 = {.type = TYPE_INT8, .data8 = {-2, 3, 4}};

content: Pointers A pointer is declared like a variable, but with * after the type What stored in a pointer variable is an address Operator & can take the address of an object or a variable of fundamental types Operator * can take the content that the pointer point to int num = 10; int *p1 = NULL, *p2 = NULL; p1 = # p2 = # *p1 = 20; *p2 = 30; Struct member accessing P -> member(*p).member struct Student { char name[4]; int born; bool male; } Student stu = {"Yu", 2000, true}; Student *pStu = &stu; strncopy(pStu -> name, "Li", 4); Print out the address Since the value of a pointer is an address, we can print it out printf("Address of stu: %p\n", pStu); // C style cout << "Address of stu: " << pStu << endl; // C++ style cout << "Address of stu: " << &stu << endl; cout << "Address of member name: " << &(pStu -> name) << endl; Pointers of Pointers Pointers are variables, they also have address int num = 10; int *p = # int **pp = &p; **pp = 5; cout << num << endl; // 5 Constant pointers int num = 1; int another = 2; // You cannot change the value the p1 points to through p1 const int* p1 = # *p1 = 3; // error num = 3; // ok // You cannot change value of p2 (address) int* const p2 = # *p2 = 3; // okay p2 = &another; // error // You cannot change either of them const int* const p3 = # int foo(const char *p) { // the value that p points to cannot be changed char *p2 = p; // syntax error // ä¸å¯ä»¥å°†ä¸€ä¸ª const æŒ‡é’ˆèµ‹å€¼ç»™ä¸€ä¸ªæ™®é€šæŒ‡é’ˆ }

content:
Pointers and Arrays Use & operator to get the addresses of elements int nums[128]; int* p0 = &nums[0]; int* p1 = &nums[1]; printf("p0 = %p
", p0); printf("p1 = %p
", p1); // the same behavior num[1] = 10; *p1 = 10; You can consider an array name as a pointer int nums[128]; printf("&nums = %p
", &nums); printf("nums = %p
", nums); printf("&nums[0] = %p
", &nums[0]); Pointer arithmetic(ç®—æœ¯æ“ä½œ) p + num or num + p points to the num-th element of the type p p - num points to the -num-th element int nums[4] = {0, 1, 2, 3}; int* p = nums + 1; // *p == 1 p++; // *p == 2 // p[1] == 3 Be careful of out-of-bound Differences between a pointer and an array Array is a constant pointer The total size of all elements in an array can be got by operator sizeof sizeof operator to a pointer will return the size of the address (4 or 8) int nums[4] = {0, 1, 2, 3}; int* p = nums; cout << sizeof(nums) << endl; // 4 * sizeof(int) cout << sizeof(p) << endl; // 4 or 8 cout << sizeof(double*) << endl; // 4 or 8

content: Allocate memory: C style Program memory The address space of a program contains several data segments Code: executable code Data: initialized static variables BSS: uninitialized static data including variables and constants Heap: dynamically allocated memory Stack: local variables, call stack Memoy allocation ä¸é™æ€ç”³è¯·å†…å­˜çš„æ–¹å¼ç›¸æ¯”ï¼ŒåŠ¨æ€ç”³è¯·å†…å­˜å¯ä»¥è·å¾—æ›´å¤§çš„å†…å­˜ç©ºé—´ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ç”³è¯·ä¸€ä¸ªéå¸¸å¤§çš„æ•°ç»„ç©ºé—´ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ int nums[SIZE] çš„æ–¹å¼å‡ºç°å†…å­˜ä¸è¶³çš„æƒ…å†µæ—¶ï¼Œæ¢æˆ int* nums = malloc(sizeof(int) * SIZE) å¯èƒ½å¯ä»¥è§£å†³ã€‚ Allocate size bytes of uninitialized storage void* malloc(size_t size) Memory deallocation The dynamically allocated memory must be deallocated explicitly(æ˜¾å¼) void foo() { int* p = malloc(sizeof(int)); return; } // memoy leak Memory leak: No variable to keep the first address. The management system will not deallocate it automatically. Waste of memory.
title: C/C++ç¨‹åºè®¾è®¡

content: Allocate memory: C++ style Operator new and new[] Operator new is similar with malloc() but with more features // allocate an int, default initializer (do nothing) int* p1 = new int; // allocate an int, initilized to 0 int* p2 = new int(); // allocate an int, initilized to 5 int* p3 = new int(5); // allocate an int, initilized to 0 int* p4 = new int{}; // allocate an int, initilized to 5 int* p5 = new int{5}; // allocate a Student object, default initilizer Student* ps1 = new Student; // allocate a Student object, initialize the members Student* ps2 = new Student{"Yu", 2020, 1}; // allocate 16 int, default initializer (do nothing) int* pa1 = new int[16]; // allocate 16 int, zero initialized int* pa2 = new int[16](); // allocate 16 int, zero initialized int* pa3 = new int[16]{}; // allocate 16 int, the first 3 element are initialized to 1,2,3, the rest 0 int* pa3 = new int[16]{1, 2, 3}; // allocate memory for 16 Student objects, default initialize Student* psa1 = new Student[16]; // allocate memory for 16 Student objects, the first two are initilized Student* psa2 = new Student[16]{{"Li", 2000, 1}, {"Yu", 2001, 1}}; Operator delete and delete[] Destroys object/objects allocated by new and free memory // deallocate memory delete p1; // deallocate the memory of the array delete pa1; // deallocate the memory of the array delete []pa2; // deallocate the memory of the array, and call the destructor of the first element delete psa1; // deallocate the memory of the array, and call the destructors of all the elements delete []psa2;

content: Functions the pointer should be checked first float matrix_max(struct Matrix mat) { float max = FLT_MIN; for (int r = 0; r < mat.rows; r++) { for (int c = 0; c < mat.cols; c++) { float val = mat.pData[r * mat.cols + c]; max = (max > val ? max : val); } } return max; } if Matrix::pData is NULL or an invalid value, how to tell the calling function from the called one? Where should a function be? // draw.h #ifndef __DRAW_H__ // é˜²æ­¢è¢«å¤šæ¬¡è°ƒç”¨é‡å¤å®šä¹‰ #define __DRAW_H__ bool drawLine(int, int, int, int); bool drawRectangle(int, int, int, int); #endif // draw.cpp #include <draw.h> bool drawRectangle(int x1, int x2, int y1, int y2) { //... drawLine(...); drawLine(...); drawline(...); drawLine(...); return true; } bool drawLine(int x1, int x2, int y1, int y2) { //... return true; } // mian.cpp #include <draw.h> int main() { //... drawRectangle(...); //... return 0; }

content: Function Parameters Parameters The symbolic name for â€œdataâ€ that passes into a function Two ways to pass into a function: Pass by value Pass by reference Pass by value: fundamental type(int, double, float, â€¦) The parameter is a copy of the original variable int foo(int x) { // x is a copy x += 10; return x; } int main() { int num1 = 20; int num2 = foo(num1); // num1 will not be changed return 0; } Pass by value: pointer int foo(int* p) { (*p) += 10; return *p; } int main() { int num1 = 20; int* p = &num1; // num1 will be changed // It still is passing by value (the address) // A copy of the address int num2 = foo(p); return 0; } Pass by value: structure struct Matrix { int rows; int cols; float* pData; } float matrix_max(struct Matrix mat) { float max = FLT_MIN; for (int r = 0; r < mat.rows; r++) { for (int c = 0; c < mat.cols; c++) { float val = mat.pData[r * mat.cols + c]; max = (max > val ? max : val); } } return max; }
title: C/C++ç¨‹åºè®¾è®¡

content: References References in C++ References are in C++, not in C A reference is an alias(åˆ«å) to an already-existing variable/object int num = 10; int& num_ref = num; num_ref = 10; cout << "num = " << num << endl; // "num = 10" A reference to an object struct Matrix { int rows; int cols; float* pData; } Matrix matA = {3, 4}; mat.pData = new float[matA.rows * matA.cols]{} Matrix& matA_ref = matA; A reference must be initialized after its declaration Reference VS Pointer: References are much safer Function parameters with a huge structure If the huge struct is passed as a function parameter struct PersonInfo { char firstname[256]; char middlename[256]; char lastname[256]; char address[256]; char nationalID[16]; // and more }; char* fullname(struct PersonInfo pi) { // ... } The data will be copied. Not a good choice One solution is to use a pointer char* fullname(struct PersonInfo* ppi) { if (ppi == NULL) { cerr << "Invalid pointer" << endl; return NULL; } // ... } References as a function parameters No data copying in the reference version; Better efficiency The modification to a reference will affect the original object char* fullname(struct PersonInfo& pi) { // ... } To avoid the data is modified by mistakes char* fullname(const struct PersonInfo& pi) { // ... }
title: C/C++ç¨‹åºè®¾è®¡

content: Return statement Statement return; is only vaild if the function return type is void Just finish the execution of the function, no value returned void print_gender(bool isMale) { if (isMale) { cout << "Male" << endl; } else { cout << "Female" << endl; } return; } void print_gender(bool isMale) { if (isMale) cout << "Male" << endl; else cout << "Female" << endl; } The return type can be a fundamental type or a compound type Pass by value: Fundamental types: the value of a constant/variable is copied Pointers: the address is copied Structures: the whole structure is copied float maxa = matrix_max(matA); Matrix* pMat = creat_matrix(4, 5); If we have a lot to return Such as a matrix addition function (A + B -> C) A suggested prototype: To use references to avoid data copying To use const parameters to avoid the input data is modified To use non-const reference parameters to receive the output bool matrix_add(const Matrix& matA, const Matrix& matB, Matrix& matC) { // check the dimensions of the three matrices // re-create matC if needed // do: matC = matA + matB // return true if everything is right } C è¯­è¨€çš„è¿”å›å€¼åªèƒ½æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ª Similar mechanism in OpenCV Matrix add in OpenCV void cv::add(InputArray src1, InputArray src2, OutputArray dst, InputArray mask, int dtype) { CV_INSTRUMENT_REGION(); arithm(src1, src2, mask, dtype, getAddTab(), false); }
title: C/C++ç¨‹åºè®¾è®¡

content: Inline function(å†…è”å‡½æ•°) Inline function Stack operations and jumps are needed for a function call It is a heavy cost for some frequently called tiny functions float max_function(float a, float b) { if (a > b) { return a; } else { return b; } } int main() { int num1 = 20; int num2 = 30; int maxv = max_function(num1, num2); // ... } The generated instructions by a compiler can be as follows to improve efficiency int main() { int num1 = 20; int num2 = 30; int maxv = { if (num1 > num2) { return num1; } else { return num2; } }; } inline suggests the compiler to perform that kind of optimizations The compiler may not follow your suggestion if the function is too complex or contains some constrains Some functions without inline may be optimized as an inline one inline float max_function(float a, float b) { if (a > b) { return a; } else { return b; } } Why not use a macros? #define MAX_MACROS(a, b) (a) > (b) ? (a) : (b) The source code will be replaced by a preprocessor Surely no cost of a function call And a, b can be any types which can compare int main() { int num1 = 20; int num2 = 30; int maxv = max_function(num1++, num2++); cout << maxv << endl; // 30 // num1 = 21, num2 = 31 maxv = MAX_MACROS(num1++, num2++); cout << maxv << endl; // 32 // num1 = 22, num2 = 33 }

content: Default Arguments Default arguments A feature in C++ (not C) To call a function without providing one or more trailing(æ‹–å°¾çš„) arguments. float norm(float x, float y, float z); float norm(float x, float y, float z = 0); // 0 is a argument, z is a parameter float norm(float x, float y = 0, float z); // åˆ†åˆ«è®¾ç½®äº† y å’Œ z çš„é»˜è®¤å‚æ•°å‡ä¸º 0ï¼Œé»˜è®¤å‚æ•°çš„å®šä¹‰ä¸€å®šæ˜¯ä»å°¾éƒ¨å¼€å§‹å®šä¹‰çš„ // é»˜è®¤å‚æ•°ä¸å¯ä»¥é‡å®šä¹‰ï¼Œåªå¯ä»¥è®¾ç½®ä¸€æ¬¡

content: Function Overloading(å‡½æ•°é‡è½½) A feature in C++ (not C) Why to overload? C99 // <math.h> double round (double x); float roundf (float x); long double roundl (long double x); C++11 // <cmath> double round (double x); float round (float x); long double round (long double x); Function overloading Which function to choose? the compiler will perform name lookup Argument-dependent lookup, also known as ADL The return type will not be considered in name lookup Functions that differ only in their return type cannot be overload

content: Function Templates(æ¨¡æ¿) Why function templates The definitions of some overloaded functions may be similar int sum(int x, int y) { cout << "sum(int, int) is called" << endl; return x + y; } float sum(float x, float y) { cout << "sum(float, float) is called" << endl; return x + y; } double sum(double x, double y) { cout << "sum(double, double) is called" << endl; return x + y; } Explicit instantiation(æ˜¾å¼å®ä¾‹åŒ–) A function template is not a type, or a function, or any other entity No code is generated from a source file that contains only template definitions The template arguments must be determined, then the compiler can generate an actual function template<typename T> T sum(T x, T y) { cout << "The input type is " << typeid(T).name() << endl; return x + y; } // instantiation template double sum<double>(double, double); template char sum<>(char, char); template int sum(int, int); Implicit instantiation(éšå¼å®ä¾‹åŒ–) Implicit instantiation occurs when a function template is not explicitly instantiated template<tempname T> T product(T x, T y){ cout << "The input type is " << typeid(T).name() << endl; return x * y; } // Implicitly instantiates product<int>(int, int) cout << "product = " << product<int>(2.2f, 3.3f) << endl; // Implicitly instantiates product<float>(float, float) cout << "product = " << product(2.2f, 3.3f) Function template specialization We have a function template template<typename T> T sum(T x, T y) If the input type is Point struct Point { int x; int y; } But no operator for Point We need to give a special definition for this case template<typename T> T sum(T x, T y) { cout << "The input type is " << typeid(T).name() << endl; return x + y; } // Specialization for Point + Point operation template<> Point sum<Point>(Point pt1, Point pt2) { cout << "The input type is " << typeid(pt1).name() << endl; Point pt; pt.x = pt1.x + pt2.x; pt.y = pt1.y + pt2.y; return pt; }

content: Function Pointers and References Function pointers norm_ptr is a pointer, a function pointer The function should have two float parameters, and returns float float norm_l1(float x, float y); float norm_l2(float x, float y); float (*norm_ptr)(float x, float y); norm_ptr = norm_l1; // Pointer norm_ptr is pointing to norm_l1 norm_ptr = &norm_l2; // Pointer norm_ptr is pointing to norm_l1 float len1 = norm_ptr(-3.f, 4.f); // function invoked float len2 = (*norm_ptr)(-3.f, 4.f);// function invoked A function pointer can be an argument and pass to a function // <stdlib.h> void qsort(void* ptr, size_t count, size_t size, int (*comp)(const void*, const void*)); To sort some customized types Function references float norm_l1(float x, float y); // declaration float norm_l2(float x, float y); // declaration float (&norm_ref)(float x, float y) = norm_l1; // norm_ref is a function reference // A reference must be initialized after its declaration

content: Recursive(é€’å½’) Function A simple example int main() { div2(1024.); // call the recursive function return 0; } void div2(double val) { cout << "Entering val = " << val << endl; if (val > 1.0) { div(val / 2); // function calls itself } else { cout << "----------" << endl; } cout << "Leaving val = " << val << endl; } Pros and Cons Pros Good at tree traversal Less lines of source code Cons Consume more stack memory May be slow Difficult to implement and debug

content: An Example with SIMD and OpenMP Functions for dot product // matoperation.hpp #pragma once float dotproduct(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n); float dotproduct_unloop(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n); float dotproduct_avx2(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n); float dotproduct_avx2_omp(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n); float dotproduct_neon(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n); float dotproduct_neon_omp(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n); // matoperation.cpp #include <iostream> #include "matoperation.hpp" #ifdef WITH_AVX2 #include <immintrin.h> #endif #ifdef WITH_NEON #include <arm_neon.h> #endif #ifdef _OPENMP #include <omp.h> #endif float dotproduct(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n) { float sum = 0.0f; for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i++) { sum += (p1[i] * p2[i]); } return sum; } float dotproduct_unloop(const float* p1, const float* p2, size_t n) { if (n % 8 != 0) { std::cerr << "The size n must be a multiple of 8." << std::endl; return 0.0f; } float sum = 0.0f; for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i += 8) { sum += (p1[i] * p2[i]); sum += (p1[i+1] * p2[i+1]); sum += (p1[i+2] * p2[i+2]); sum += (p1[i+3] * p2[i+3]); sum += (p1[i+4] * p2[i+4]); sum += (p1[i+5] * p2[i+5]); sum += (p1[i+6] * p2[i+6]); sum += (p1[i+7] * p2[i+7]); } return sum; } float dotproduct_avx2(const float* p1, const float* p2) { #ifdef WITH_AVX2 if (n % 8 != 0) { std::cerr << "The size n must be a multiple of 8." << std::endl; return 0.0f; } float sum[8] = {0}; __m256 a, b; __m256 c = _mm256_setzero_ps(); for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i += 8) { a = _mm256_load_ps(p1 + i); b = _mm256_load_ps(p2 + i); c = _mm256_add_ps(c, _mm256_mul_ps(a, b)); } _mm256_store_ps(sum, c); return (sum[0] + sum[1] + sum[2] + sum[3] + sum[4] + sum[5] + sum[6] + sum[7]); #else std::cerr << "AVX2 is not supported" << std::endl; return 0.0f; #endif } float dotproduct_avx2_omp(const float* p1, const float* p2) { #ifdef WITH_AVX2 if (n % 8 != 0) { std::cerr << "The size n must be a multiple of 8." << std::endl; return 0.0f; } float sum[8] = {0}; __m256 a, b; __m256 c = _mm256_setzero_ps(); #pragma omp parallel for for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i += 8) { a = _mm256_load_ps(p1 + i); b = _mm256_load_ps(p2 + i); c = _mm256_add_ps(c, _mm256_mul_ps(a, b)); } _mm256_store_ps(sum, c); return (sum[0] + sum[1] + sum[2] + sum[3] + sum[4] + sum[5] + sum[6] + sum[7]); #else std::cerr << "AVX2 is not supported" << std::endl; return 0.0f; #endif } float dotproduct_neon(const float* p1, const float* p2) { #ifdef WITH_NEON if (n % 4 != 0) { std::cerr << "The size n must be a multiple of 4." << std::endl; return 0.0f; } float sum[4] = {0}; float32x4 a, b; float32x4 c = vdupq_n_f32(0); for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i += 4) { a = vld1q_f32(p1 + i); b = vld1q_f32(p2 + i); c = vaddq_f32(c, vmulq_f32(a, b)); } vst1q_f32(sum, c); return (sum[0] + sum[1] + sum[2] + sum[3]); #else std::cerr << "NEON is not supported" << std::endl; return 0.0f; #endif } float dotproduct_neon_omp(const float* p1, const float* p2) { #ifdef WITH_NEON if (n % 4 != 0) { std::cerr << "The size n must be a multiple of 4." << std::endl; return 0.0f; } float sum[4] = {0}; float32x4 a, b; float32x4 c = vdupq_n_f32(0); #pragma omp parallel for for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i += 4) { a = vld1q_f32(p1 + i); b = vld1q_f32(p2 + i); // å¤šçº¿ç¨‹å†™å†²çªå¯¼è‡´ç»“æœé”™è¯¯ c = vaddq_f32(c, vmulq_f32(a, b)); } vst1q_f32(sum, c); return (sum[0] + sum[1] + sum[2] + sum[3]); #else std::cerr << "NEON is not supported" << std::endl; return 0.0f; #endif } // main.cpp #include <iostream> #include <cstdlib> #include <chrono> #include "matoperation.hpp" using namespace std; #define TIME_START start = std::chrono::steady_clock::now(); #define TIME_END(NAME) end = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();\ duration = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds> (end - start).count();\ cout << (NAME) << ": result = " << result\ << ", duration = " << duration << "ms" << endl; int main(int argc, char** argv) { size_t nSize = 200000000; // float* p1 =

content: Classes and Objects Structures A struct in C is a type consisting of a sequence of data members Some functions/statements are needed to operate the data members of an object of a struct type struct Student { char name[4]; int born; bool male; }; struct Student stu; strcpy(stu.name, "Yu"); stu.born = 2000; stu.male = true; Classes You should be very careful to manipulated the data members in a struct object We can put some member functions in class class Student { public: char name[4]; int born; bool male; void setName(const char* s) { strncpy(name, s, sizeof(name)); } void setBorn(int b) { //... } }; Student stu; stu.setName("Yu"); Access Specifiers You can protect data members by access specifier private Then data member can only be accessed by well designed member functions é»˜è®¤ä¸º private class Student { private: char name[4]; int born; bool male; public: void setName(const char* s) { strncpy(name, s, sizeof(name)); } void setBorn(int b) { // ... } }; Member Functions A member function can be defined inside or outside class class Student { private: char name[4]; int born; bool male; public: void setName(const char* s) { strncpy(name, s, sizeof(name)); } void setBorn(int b) { born = b; } void setGender(bool isMale); void printInfo(); }; inline void Student::setGender(bool isMale) { male = isMale; } void Student::printInfo() { cout << "Name: " << name << endl; cout << "Born in: " << born << endl; cout << "Gender: " << (male ? "Male" : "Female") << endl; } å¯¹ç±»çš„å®šä¹‰ä¸€èˆ¬æ”¾åœ¨ .hpp å¤´æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­ï¼Œè€Œå°†æ‰€æœ‰çš„å‡½æ•°æ”¾åœ¨ .cpp ä¸­ã€‚ æŠ€å·§ include <XXX> ä¸ include "XXX" çš„åŒºåˆ«ï¼š include <XXX> ä½¿å¾—ç¼–è¯‘å™¨ä»ç¼–è¯‘å™¨æŒ‡å®šçš„å¤´æ–‡ä»¶ç›®å½•å»å¯»æ‰¾å¤´æ–‡ä»¶ include "XXX" ä½¿å¾—ç¼–è¯‘å™¨ä¸æ­¢ä»ç¼–è¯‘å™¨æŒ‡å®šçš„å¤´æ–‡ä»¶ç›®å½•ä¸­å»å¯»æ‰¾å¤´æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œè€Œä¸”åœ¨ .cpp çš„å½“å‰ç›®å½•ä¸‹å¯»æ‰¾å¤´æ–‡ä»¶

content: Constructors(æ„é€ å‡½æ•°) and Destructors(ææ„å‡½æ•°) Constructors Different from struct in C, a constructor will be invoked(è°ƒç”¨) when creating an object of a class struct in C: allocate memory class in C++: allcoate memory & invoke a constructor But â€¦ No constructor is defined explicitly in previous examples The compiler will generate one with empty body Constructor The same name with the class Have no return value æ„é€ å‡½æ•°å¯ä»¥é‡è½½ class Student { private: // ... public: Student() { name[0] = 0; born = 0; male = false; } Student(const char* initName, int initBorn, bool isMale) { setName(initName); born = initBorn; male = isMale; } }; The members can also be initialized as follows Student(const char* initName): born(0), male(true) { setName(initName); } æ„é€ å‡½æ•°çš„è°ƒç”¨ Student yu; Student li("Li"); Student xue = Student("Xue", 1962, true); Student* zhou = new Student("Zhou", 1991, false); Desturctors The destructor will be invoked when the object is destroyed Be formed from the class name preceded by a tilde(~) Have no return value, no parameters ææ„å‡½æ•°ä¸å¯ä»¥é‡è½½ å½“ä¸€ä¸ªå¯¹è±¡é€€å‡ºå…¶ä½œç”¨åŸŸæ—¶ä¼šè¢«è‡ªåŠ¨é”€æ¯ class Student { private: // ... public: Student() { name = new char[1024]{0}; born = 0; male = false; } ~Student() { delete [] name; } }; Student* zhou = new Student("Zhou", 1991, false); delete zhou; // æ‰‹åŠ¨é”€æ¯ delete å’Œ delete[] ä¹‹é—´çš„åŒºåˆ«ï¼š Student* class1 = new Student[3] { {"Tom", 2000, true}, {"Bob", 2001, true}, {"Amy", 2002, false}, }; delete class1; // åªä¼šè°ƒç”¨ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªæˆå‘˜çš„ææ„å‡½æ•° delete[] class1; // ä¼šè°ƒç”¨æ‰€æœ‰æˆå‘˜çš„ææ„å‡½æ•°

content: this Pointer Why is this needed? How does a member function know which name? void setName(const char* s) { strncpy(name, s, 1024); } Student yu = Student{"Yu", 2000, true}; Student amy = Student{"Amy", 2000, true}; yu.setName("yu"); amy.setName("Amy"); this Pointer All methods in a function have a this pointer It is set to the address of the object that invokes the method void setBorn(int b) { born = b; } void setBorn(int b) { this -> born = b; } void setBorn(int born) { this -> born = born; }

content: const and static Members const variables Statements for constants #define VALUE 100 const int value = 100; const int* p_int; // æŒ‡é’ˆæŒ‡å‘çš„å†…å®¹ä¸å¯ä»¥é€è¿‡æŒ‡é’ˆä¿®æ”¹ int const *p_int; int* const p_int; // æŒ‡é’ˆæŒ‡å‘çš„åœ°å€ä¸å¯ä»¥è¢«ä¿®æ”¹ void func(const int*); void func(const int&); const members const member variables behavior similar with normal const varibales const member functions promise not to modify member variables class Student { private: const int BMI = 24; // ... public: Student() { BMI = 25; // can't be modified } int getBorn() const { born++; // can't be modified return born; } }; static members static members are not bound to class instance class Student { private: static size_t student_total; // declarration only; inline static size_t student_total = 0; // C++17, definition outside isn't needed public: Student() { student_total++; } ~Student() { student_total--; } static size_t getTotal() { return student_total; } // definition it here size_t Student::student_total = 0; }

content: æ€è€ƒ content: 1.1 äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„å±‚æ¬¡éå†-è¿­ä»£ç®—æ³• ä»£ç ï¼š /** * Definition for a binary tree node. * struct TreeNode { * int val; * struct TreeNode *left; * struct TreeNode *right; * }; */ /** * Return an array of arrays of size *returnSize. * The sizes of the arrays are returned as *returnColumnSizes array. * Note: Both returned array and *columnSizes array must be malloced, assume caller calls free(). */ int** levelOrder(struct TreeNode* root, int* returnSize, int** returnColumnSizes){ *returnSize = 0; if (root == NULL) { return NULL; } *returnColumnSizes = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int) * 1000); // äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„æœ€å¤§æ·±åº¦ int** ans = (int **)malloc(sizeof(int *) * 1000); // äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„æœ€å¤§æ·±åº¦ struct TreeNode *queue[2000], *curNode; // äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹æ•°é‡ int head = 0, tail = 0, curLevelTail, curLevelNodeNum; queue[tail++] = root; while (head != tail) { curLevelTail = tail; curLevelNodeNum = 0; ans[*returnSize] = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int) * (tail - head)); while(head != curLevelTail) { curNode = queue[head++]; ans[*returnSize][curLevelNodeNum++] = curNode -> val; if (curNode -> left) { queue[tail++] = curNode -> left; } if (curNode -> right) { queue[tail++] = curNode -> right; } } (*returnColumnSizes)[(*returnSize)++] = curLevelNodeNum; } return ans; }

content: LC 315. è®¡ç®—å³ä¾§å°äºå½“å‰å…ƒç´ çš„ä¸ªæ•° æ€è·¯ï¼š å€’ç½®è¾“å…¥æ•´æ•°æ•°ç»„åä¸ºIï¼Œæ–°å»ºæ’åºæ•°ç»„åä¸ºSå’Œç»“æœæ•°ç»„Rã€‚è¿›å…¥å¾ªç¯ã€‚ è‹¥è¾“å…¥æ•°ç»„Iè¢«å–å°½ï¼Œåˆ™é€€å‡ºå¾ªç¯ æ¯æ¬¡å¾ªç¯ä»è¾“å…¥æ•°ç»„Iä¸­å–å‡ºä¸€ä¸ªæ•° ä½¿ç”¨äºŒåˆ†æŸ¥æ‰¾æŸ¥è¯¢åº”å½“æ’å…¥Sçš„ä½ç½®ï¼Œæ’å…¥çš„ä½ç½®å³ä¸ºå³ä¾§å°äºå½“å‰å…ƒç´ çš„ä¸ªæ•°ï¼Œä¿å­˜è‡³Rã€‚ å°†æ•°å­—æ’å…¥Sã€‚ è¿”å›Rã€‚ è¿™æ ·å¯ä»¥æ§åˆ¶æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦åœ¨$\mathcal{O}(nlogn)$ã€‚ ä»£ç ï¼š int binarySearch(int* nums, int l, int r, int target) { if (l < r) { int m = (l + r) / 2; if (nums[m] == target) { while(nums[m - 1] == target && m > l){ m -= 1; } return m; } else if (nums[m] > target) { return binarySearch(nums, l, m, target); } else { return binarySearch(nums, m + 1, r, target); } } else { return l; } } int insert(int* nums, int l, int index) { int i, num = nums[l]; for (i = l; i < l + index; i++) { nums[i] = nums[i + 1]; }; nums[i] = num; return 0; } int* countSmaller(int* nums, int numsSize, int* returnSize){ int* res = malloc(sizeof(int) * numsSize), index; *returnSize = numsSize; res[numsSize - 1] = 0; for (int i = numsSize - 1; i > 0; i--) { if (i != numsSize - 1 && nums[i] == nums[i + 1]) { index = res[i]; } else { index = binarySearch(nums, i, numsSize, nums[i - 1]); } insert(nums, i - 1, index - i); res[i - 1] = index - i; } // for (int i = 0; i < numsSize; i++) { // printf("%d,", nums[i]); // } return res; } ç†è®ºä¸Šåº”è¯¥æ˜¯å¯ä»¥çš„ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯é¡¶ä¸ä½å¸¸æ•°å¤§ã€‚æœ€åTLEï¼Œéº»äº†ã€‚ é¢˜å¤ªéš¾å…ˆæ‘¸äº†ç½¢ã€‚

content: LC 53. æœ€å¤§å­æ•°ç»„å’Œ ä»£ç ï¼š int maxSubArray(int* nums, int numsSize){ int max = nums[0], start = nums[0], cur = nums[0], i = 1; while (i < numsSize) { cur += nums[i]; if (start < 0 && nums[i] > start) { // é€iå»æ‰è´Ÿè´¡çŒ®æ•°å­— cur = nums[i]; start = nums[i]; } else if (cur < start && cur < 1 && i + 1 < numsSize) { // é€ç»„å»æ‰è´Ÿè´¡çŒ®æ•°å­— cur = nums[i + 1]; start = nums[i + 1]; i += 1; } if (cur > max) { max = cur; } i += 1; } return max; } è­¦å‘Š ä¸çŸ¥é“æˆ‘æ˜¯æ€ä¹ˆæƒ³çš„ğŸ˜€ ä»£ç ç®€åŒ–ï¼š int maxSubArray(int* nums, int numsSize){ int subsum = 0, max = nums[0]; for (int i = 0; i < numsSize; i++) { subsum = fmax(subsum + nums[i], nums[i]); max = fmax(max, subsum); } return max; }

content: å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 026. é‡æ’é“¾è¡¨ ä»£ç ï¼š struct ListNode* findMid(struct ListNode* head) { struct ListNode* f = head; struct ListNode* s = head; while (f && f -> next) { f = f -> next -> next; s = s -> next; } return s; } struct ListNode* reverseList(struct ListNode* curr) { struct ListNode* next; struct ListNode* prev = NULL; while (curr) { next = curr -> next; curr -> next = prev; prev = curr; curr = next; } return prev; } void merge(struct ListNode* l1, struct ListNode* l2) { struct ListNode* l1_next; struct ListNode* l2_next; while (l2) { l1_next = l1 -> next; l2_next = l2 -> next; l1 -> next = l2; l1 = l1_next; l2 -> next = l1; l2 = l2_next; } } void reorderList(struct ListNode* head){ // å¯»æ‰¾ä¸­é—´èŠ‚ç‚¹ struct ListNode* mid = findMid(head); struct ListNode* l1 = head; struct ListNode* l2 = mid -> next; mid -> next = NULL; // åè½¬é“¾è¡¨ l2 = reverseList(l2); // åˆå¹¶é“¾è¡¨ merge(l1, l2); }

content: LC 92. åè½¬é“¾è¡¨ II ç¬¬ä¸€æ€è·¯ç»„åˆæ‹³ï¼Œå…ˆæŠŠéœ€è¦åè½¬çš„éƒ¨åˆ†æ‹†å‡ºï¼Œåè½¬åå†è£…å›ã€‚ä»£ç ï¼š struct ListNode* reverseListNode(struct ListNode* curr) { struct ListNode* next; struct ListNode* prev = NULL; while(curr) { next = curr -> next; curr -> next = prev; prev = curr; curr = next; } return prev; } struct ListNode* reverseBetween(struct ListNode* head, int left, int right){ if (left == right) { return head; } struct ListNode *start, *end = head, *prev, *next; for (int i = 1; i < right; i++) { if (i == left - 1) { prev = end; } end = end -> next; } next = end -> next, end -> next = NULL; if (left == 1) { start = reverseListNode(head); head = start; } else { start = prev -> next, prev -> next = NULL; start = reverseListNode(start); prev -> next = start; } struct ListNode* curr = start; while (curr -> next) { curr = curr -> next; } curr -> next = next; return head; } ç¬¬äºŒæ€è·¯è¿ç»­æ‹³ï¼Œèµ°åˆ°éœ€è¦åè½¬çš„åœ°æ–¹å°±è¿›è¡Œåè½¬ã€‚ä»£ç ï¼š struct ListNode* reverseBetween(struct ListNode* head, int left, int right){ struct ListNode *dummy = malloc(sizeof(struct ListNode)); dummy -> next = head; struct ListNode *pre = dummy; int i = 1; for (; i < left; i++) { pre = pre -> next; } struct ListNode *cur = pre -> next; struct ListNode *next; for (; i < right; i++) { next = cur -> next; cur -> next = next -> next; next -> next = pre -> next; pre -> next = next; } return dummy -> next; }

content: LC 105. ä»å‰åºä¸ä¸­åºéå†åºåˆ—æ„é€ äºŒå‰æ ‘ å‰é—­åé—­æ³¨æ„é€€å‡ºæ¡ä»¶ç®€å•é€’å½’å³å¯ã€‚ struct TreeNode* buildSubTree(int* preorder, int prel, int prer, int* inorder, int inl, int inr) { if (prel > prer || inl > inr) { return NULL; } struct TreeNode* root = malloc(sizeof(struct TreeNode)); root -> val = preorder[prel]; if (prel < prer) { int NodeSize = 0; for (int i = inl; preorder[prel] != inorder[i]; i++) { NodeSize++; } root -> left = buildSubTree(preorder, prel + 1, prel + NodeSize, inorder, inl, inl + NodeSize - 1); root -> right = buildSubTree(preorder, prel + 1 + NodeSize, prer, inorder, inl + 1 + NodeSize, inr); } else { root -> left = NULL; root -> right = NULL; } return root; } struct TreeNode* buildTree(int* preorder, int preorderSize, int* inorder, int inorderSize){ struct TreeNode* root = buildSubTree(preorder, 0, preorderSize - 1, inorder, 0, inorderSize - 1); return root; }

content: å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer 55 - II. å¹³è¡¡äºŒå‰æ ‘ å¯¹äºæœ¬é¢˜ï¼Œé€’å½’æ—¶æˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦ä¸¤ç§ä¿¡æ¯ï¼Œä¸€ç§æ˜¯å½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹çš„é«˜åº¦ï¼Œç¬¬äºŒç§æ˜¯è¯¥èŠ‚ç‚¹æ˜¯å¦å¹³æ¨ªã€‚è¿™å¯¹äºåªèƒ½è¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªå€¼çš„Cè¯­è¨€æ¥è®²ç›¸å½“ä¸å‹å¥½ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯æ³¨æ„åˆ°ï¼Œå¦‚æœæŸèŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸å¹³è¡¡ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆèŠ‚ç‚¹çš„é«˜åº¦ä¾¿æ²¡æœ‰è®¡ç®—ä¸‹å»çš„å¿…è¦ï¼Œåªéœ€è¦é€’å½’è¿”å›å°†èŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸å¹³è¡¡çš„ä¿¡æ¯returnå³å¯ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶èŠ‚ç‚¹çš„é«˜åº¦ä¸€å®šæ˜¯éè´Ÿæ•°ã€‚å› æ­¤å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨è´Ÿæ•°æ¥è¡¨ç¤ºèŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸å¹³è¡¡çš„çŠ¶æ€ã€‚ ä»£ç å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š int height(struct TreeNode* root) { if (root == NULL) { return 0; } int leftheight = height(root -> left); int rightheight = height(root -> right); if (leftheight == -1 || rightheight == -1 || fabs(leftheight - rightheight) > 1) { return -1; } else { return fmax(leftheight, rightheight) + 1; } } bool isBalanced(struct TreeNode* root){ return height(root) >= 0; }

content: å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer 34. äºŒå‰æ ‘ä¸­å’Œä¸ºæŸä¸€å€¼çš„è·¯å¾„ æ·±åº¦ä¼˜å…ˆæœç´¢å›æº¯ç®—æ³•ã€‚ int** ret; // å½“å‰æ‰€æœ‰çš„å¯è¡Œè·¯å¾„ int retSize; // å½“å‰æ‰€æœ‰å¯è¡Œè·¯å¾„çš„æ•°é‡ int* retColSize; // å½“å‰æ‰€æœ‰å¯è¡Œè·¯å¾„æ¯ä¸ªè·¯å¾„çš„å¤§å° int* path; // å½“å‰è·¯å¾„å€¼çš„æ•°ç»„ int pathSize; // å½“å‰è·¯å¾„å€¼æ•°ç»„çš„å¤§å° int tar; // å½“å‰è·¯å¾„å€¼æ•°ç»„å’Œä¸targetçš„å·®è· void dfs(struct TreeNode* root) { if (root == NULL) { return; // ç»“æŸæ¡ä»¶ } path[pathSize++] = root -> val; // å°†å½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹å€¼ä¸²åœ¨å½“å‰è·¯å¾„æ•°ç»„å tar -= root -> val; // tarå‡å»å½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹å€¼ if (root -> left == NULL && root -> right == NULL && tar == 0) { // è‹¥æ»¡è¶³æ‰€å¯»è·¯å¾„æ¡ä»¶ int* tmp = malloc(sizeof(int) * pathSize); // åˆ†é…ä¸´æ—¶æ•°ç»„ memcpy(tmp, path, sizeof(int) * pathSize); // å†…å­˜å¤åˆ¶ ret[retSize] = tmp; // å°†è·¯å¾„ä¿å­˜åˆ°ret retColSize[retSize++] = pathSize; // å°†è·¯å¾„å¤§å°ä¿å­˜åˆ°retColSize } dfs(root -> right); // ç»§ç»­æœç´¢ dfs(root -> left); pathSize--; // å­æ ‘æœç´¢å®Œæ¯•ï¼Œè¿”å›å‰é€€å›pathSizeå’Œtar tar += root -> val; } int** pathSum(struct TreeNode* root, int target, int* returnSize, int** returnColumnSizes){ ret = malloc(sizeof(int*) * 1000); // åˆå§‹æ¢å…¨éƒ¨å˜é‡ retColSize = malloc(sizeof(int) * 1000); path = malloc(sizeof(int) * 1000); tar = target; pathSize = 0; retSize = 0; dfs(root); // æ·±åº¦ä¼˜å…ˆæœç´¢ *returnSize = retSize; *returnColumnSizes = retColSize; return ret; }

content: LC 38. å¤–è§‚æ•°åˆ— è¿˜è¡Œï¼Œå°±æ˜¯å­—ç¬¦ä¸²æ•°ç»„æœ‰ç‚¹å¡ã€‚ void CAS(char* res) { char* tmp = malloc(sizeof(char) * 4500); char pre = res[0]; int count = 1; int size = 0; for (int i = 1; res[i] != '\0'; i++) { if (pre == res[i]) { count++; } else { tmp[size++] = count + '0'; tmp[size++] = pre; pre = res[i]; count = 1; } } tmp[size++] = count + '0'; tmp[size++] = pre; tmp[size] = '\0'; memcpy(res, tmp, sizeof(char) * (size + 1)); } char* countAndSay(int n) { char* res = malloc(sizeof(char) * 4500); res[0] = '1'; res[1] = '\0'; for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) { CAS(res); } return res; }

content: å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 101. åˆ†å‰²ç­‰å’Œå­é›† NPå®Œå…¨é—®é¢˜ï¼ŒåŠ¨æ€è§„åˆ’æ±‚è§£ã€‚ bool canPartition(int* nums, int numsSize) { if (numsSize < 2) { return false; } int sum = 0, maxNum = 0; for (int i = 0; i < numsSize; ++i) { sum += nums[i]; maxNum = fmax(maxNum, nums[i]); } if (sum & 1) { return false; } int target = sum / 2; if (maxNum > target) { return false; } int dp[numsSize][target + 1]; memset(dp, 0, sizeof(dp)); for (int i = 0; i < numsSize; i++) { dp[i][0] = true; } dp[0][nums[0]] = true; for (int i = 1; i < numsSize; i++) { int num = nums[i]; for (int j = 1; j <= target; j++) { if (j >= num) { dp[i][j] = dp[i - 1][j] | dp[i - 1][j - num]; } else { dp[i][j] = dp[i - 1][j]; } } } return dp[numsSize - 1][target]; } äº‹å®ä¸Šæ³¨æ„åˆ°çŠ¶æ€è½¬ç§»æ–¹ç¨‹å½“å‰è¡Œåªä¸ä¸Šä¸€è¡Œæœ‰å…³ï¼Œå› æ­¤å¯ä»¥åŸåœ°dpã€‚ ä»£ç ï¼š bool canPartition(int* nums, int numsSize) { if (numsSize < 2) { return false; } int sum = 0, maxNum = 0; for (int i = 0; i < numsSize; ++i) { sum += nums[i]; maxNum = fmax(maxNum, nums[i]); } if (sum & 1) { return false; } int target = sum / 2; if (maxNum > target) { return false; } int dp[target + 1]; memset(dp, 0, sizeof(dp)); dp[0] = true; for (int i = 0; i < numsSize; i++) { int num = nums[i]; for (int j = target; j >= num; --j) { dp[j] |= dp[j - num]; } } return dp[target]; }

p[0] = a[0]; for (i = 1; i < n; i++) { p[i + 1] = p[i] + a[i]; } } void psum2(float2 a[], float p[], long n) { long i; p[0] = a[0]; for (i = 1; i < n - 1; n += 2) { float mid_val = p[i - 1] + a[i]; p[i] = mid_val; p[i + 1] = mid_val + a[i + 1]; } /* For even n, finish remaining element */ if (i < n) p[i] = p[i - 1] + a[i]; } å¾ªç¯å±•å¼€å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨æ›´å°‘çš„å¾ªç¯æ¬¡æ•°å®Œæˆè®¡ç®—ï¼Œå‡å°‘è®¡ç®—çš„æ—¶é—´ã€‚ æœ€å°äºŒä¹˜æ‹Ÿåˆ å¯¹äºä¸€ä¸ªæ•°æ®ç‚¹$(x_1, y_1), (x_2, y_2), â€¦, (x_n, y_n)$çš„é›†åˆï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æœ€å°äºŒä¹˜æ‹Ÿåˆï¼Œå¯»æ‰¾ä¸€æ¡å½¢å¦‚$y=mx+b$çš„çº¿ï¼Œä½¿å¾—ä¸‹é¢è¿™ä¸ªè¯¯å·®åº¦é‡æœ€å°ï¼š $$ E(m,b)= \sum_{i=1}^{n}(mx_i+b-y_i)^2 $$ å°†$E(m,b)$åˆ†åˆ«å¯¹$m$å’Œ$b$è¿›è¡Œæ±‚å¯¼ï¼ŒæŠŠä¸¤ä¸ªå‡½æ•°çš„å¯¼æ•°è®¾ä¸º0,è¿›è¡Œæ¨å¯¼å³å¯çš„å‡ºç»“æœã€‚ ç»“æ„ä½“çš„ç‚¹è¿ç®—ç¬¦ï¼ˆ.ï¼‰å’Œç®­å¤´è¿ç®—ç¬¦ï¼ˆ->ï¼‰ã€‚ ç‚¹è¿ç®—ç¬¦ç”¨äºç»“æ„ä½“å¯¹è±¡è®¿é—®å…¶æˆå‘˜ï¼Œè€Œç®­å¤´è¿ç®—ç¬¦ç”¨äºç»“æ„ä½“å¯¹è±¡çš„æŒ‡é’ˆè®¿é—®å…¶æˆå‘˜ã€‚ struct student { char Name[10]; short age; } stu, *pstu; short age = stu.age; short age = pstu -> age; å†…å­˜åˆ†é…å‡½æ•°ã€‚ malloc void *malloc(size_t size); å‚æ•°ï¼š size - å…ƒç´ çš„å¤§å° è¯¥å‡½æ•°è¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªæŒ‡é’ˆ ï¼ŒæŒ‡å‘å·²åˆ†é…å¤§å°çš„å†…å­˜ã€‚å¦‚æœè¯·æ±‚å¤±è´¥ï¼Œåˆ™è¿”å› NULLã€‚ calloc void *calloc(size_t nitems, size_t size); å‚æ•°ï¼š nitems - è¦è¢«åˆ†é…çš„å…ƒç´ ä¸ªæ•° size - å…ƒç´ çš„å¤§å° è¯¥å‡½æ•°è¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªæŒ‡é’ˆï¼ŒæŒ‡å‘å·²åˆ†é…çš„å†…å­˜ã€‚å¦‚æœè¯·æ±‚å¤±è´¥ï¼Œåˆ™è¿”å› NULLã€‚ä¸mallocä¹‹é—´çš„ä¸åŒæ˜¯ï¼Œmallocä¸ä¼šè®¾ç½®å†…å­˜ä¸º0ï¼Œè€Œcallocä¼šè®¾ç½®å†…å­˜ä¸º0ã€‚ ç¨‹åºæ€§èƒ½æå‡ åŸå§‹ä»£ç ã€‚ #include <stdlib.h> #define IDENT 0 #define OP + typedef long data_t; /* Create abstract data type for vector */ typedef struct { long len; data_t *data; } vec_rec, *vec_ptr; /* Create vector of specified length */ vec_ptr new_vec(long len) { /* Allocate header strcuture */ vec_ptr result = (vec_ptr) malloc(sizeof(vec_rec)); data_t *data = NULL; if (!result) return NULL; /* Couldn't allocate storage */ result -> len = len; /* Allocate array */ if (len > 0) { data = (data_t *) calloc(len, sizeof(data_t)); if (!data) { free((void *) result); return NULL; /* Couldn't allocate storage */ } } /* Data will either be NULL or allocated array */ result -> data = data; return result; } /* * Retrieve vector element and store at dest. * Return 0 (out of bound) or 1 (successful) */ int get_vec_element(vec_ptr v, long index, data_t *dest) { if (index < 0 || index >= v -> len) return 0; content: ä»£ç  æ–°å»ºä¸€ä¸ªé˜Ÿåˆ—ï¼Œå°† start åŠ å…¥åˆ°é˜Ÿåˆ—å½“ä¸­ã€‚æ¯æ¬¡ä»é˜Ÿåˆ—ä¸­å–å‡ºä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œä» bank ä¸­æœç´¢æœªè®¿é—®è¿‡çš„å¹¶ä¸”å½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹å¯ä»¥åˆ°è¾¾çš„ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ ï¼Œå¹¶å°†å…¶åŠ å…¥å¯¹åˆ—ã€‚å½“ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ä¸º end æ—¶ç›´æ¥è¿”å›æœ€ç»ˆç»“æœï¼›å½“é˜Ÿåˆ—ä¸ºç©ºæ—¶ï¼Œè¿”å› end ä¸å¯è¾¾ã€‚ class Solution: def distance(self, start, end): dis = 0 for i, j in zip(start, end): if i != j: dis += 1 return dis def minMutation(self, start: str, end: str, bank: List[str]) -> int: queue = deque() queue.append((start, 0)) bank = set(bank) visit = [] res = [] while queue: curgen, curdis = queue.popleft() if curgen == end: return curdis visit = [] for gen in bank: if self.distance(gen, curgen) == 1: queue.append((gen, curdis + 1)) visit.append(gen) for gen in visit: bank.remove(gen) æ‰§è¡Œç”¨æ—¶: 40 msï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 41% çš„ Python3 æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ å†…å­˜æ¶ˆè€—: 15 MBï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 37% çš„ Python3 æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚

content: å°æ”¹è¿› class Solution: def distance(self, start, end): return sum(i != j for i, j in zip(start, end)) def minMutation(self, start: str, end: str, bank: List[str]) -> int: graph = defaultdict(list) for geni, genj in combinations([start] + bank, 2): if self.distance(geni, genj) == 1: graph[geni].append(genj) graph[genj].append(geni) queue = deque() queue.append((start, 0)) visit = set() while queue: curgen, curdis = queue.popleft() for nexgen in graph[curgen]: if nexgen == end: return curdis + 1 if nexgen in visit: continue else: visit.add(nexgen) queue.append((nexgen, curdis + 1)) return -1 ä¸åˆå§‹ä»£ç ä¸»è¦çš„åŒºåˆ«æ˜¯ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œé‡‡ç”¨äº†å…ˆè®¡ç®—å…¨éƒ¨å¯è¡Œçš„èµ°æ³•ç»„åˆï¼Œå°†æ¯ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹å¯è¡Œçš„èµ°æ³•å­˜å‚¨åœ¨å­—å…¸ä¸­ï¼Œå†è¿›è¡Œ BFS çš„åšæ³•ã€‚ç”±äºå­—å…¸çš„å¢æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦å°äºåˆ å’ŒæŸ¥ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æ—¶é—´æ¶ˆè€—æœ‰äº†è¿›ä¸€æ­¥çš„å‡å°‘ï¼š æ‰§è¡Œç”¨æ—¶: 32 msï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 87% çš„ Python3 æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ å†…å­˜æ¶ˆè€—: 15.1 MBï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 9% çš„ Python3 æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚

content: ä»£ç  class Solution: def threeSum(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]: nums.sort() length = len(nums) if length < 3: return [] res = [] for i in range(0, length - 2): for j in range(i + 1, length - 1): for k in range(j + 1, length): if nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0: el = [nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]] if el not in res: res.append(el) return res ä¸‰é‡ for å¾ªç¯å¾ˆå®¹æ˜“å®ç°ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯é—®é¢˜æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•æ’é™¤é‡å¤é¡¹ã€‚é‡å¤é¡¹çš„ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°å¯èƒ½ä»¥ä¸åŒçš„é¡ºåºæ’åˆ—ï¼Œè¿™å¢åŠ äº†æŸ¥é‡çš„éš¾åº¦ã€‚è¿™é‡Œçš„æ–¹æ³•æ˜¯å¯¹é¦–å…ˆå¯¹æ•°ç»„è¿›è¡Œæ’åºï¼Œè¿™æ ·ä¿è¯æ‰€æœ‰å¯èƒ½ä¸­çš„æ•°å¤§å°æœ‰åºï¼Œå‡å°‘æ’é™¤é‡å¤é¡¹çš„éš¾åº¦ã€‚ ç„¶åç®€ç®€å•å•çš„ TLEã€‚ æœ€å®¹æ˜“æƒ³åˆ°çš„ä¸‹ä¸€æ­¥æ”¹è¿›æ–¹å¼å°±æ˜¯ï¼Œå¦‚æœæˆ‘ä»¬å›ºå®šä½ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°ä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªæ•°ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆé—®é¢˜å°±è½¬å˜ä¸ºäº† LC1 ä¸¤æ•°ä¹‹å’Œã€‚å¯¹äºä¸¤æ•°å­—å’Œæ¥è¯´ï¼Œæœ€ä½³çš„è§£æ³•ä¸º hashmapï¼Œæ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸º $\mathcal{O}(n)$ï¼Œè€ƒè™‘å¤–å¾ªç¯ï¼Œæ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦æ¥åˆ°äº† $\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ã€‚ class Solution: def twoSum(self, nums, target): res = [] map = {} for i in range(len(nums)): need = target - nums[i] if need in map: res.append([nums[map[need]], nums[i]]) else: map[nums[i]] = i return res def threeSum(self, nums): nums.sort() length = len(nums) if length < 3: return [] res = [] for i in range(0, length - 2): others = self.twoSum(nums[i + 1:], target=-nums[i]) if others != []: for other in others: ele = [nums[i]] + other if ele not in res: res.append(ele) return res è¿™é‡Œä¸ LC1 çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå¾ˆå¤§çš„ä¸åŒæ˜¯ï¼ŒtwoSum å‡½æ•°æœ‰å¤šä¸ªå¯èƒ½çš„è¿”å›ç»“æœã€‚è¿™è¦æ±‚æˆ‘ä»¬ä¸€å®šè¦éå†å®Œæ‰€æœ‰çš„å¯èƒ½ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´è™½ç„¶æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸º $\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ï¼Œè¿è¡Œé€Ÿåº¦ä¾æ—§å¾ˆæ…¢ï¼Œå‹‰å¼ºä¸ºé€šè¿‡çš„ç»“æœã€‚ æ‰§è¡Œç”¨æ—¶: 4824 msï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 5% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ å†…å­˜æ¶ˆè€—: 17.8 MBï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 67% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚

1$ï¼Œä¹Ÿä¸ä¼šé‡åˆ°ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶çš„ç»“æœã€‚æ¢å¥è¯è¯´ï¼Œå¯¹äºå½“å‰ $k$ è€Œè¨€ï¼Œ$j \in [j, k-1]$ ä¸å¯èƒ½å­˜åœ¨ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶çš„ç»“æœã€‚ $nums[j] + nums[k] = target$ï¼š æ­¤æ—¶ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è¿”å›å€¼ã€‚ å› æ­¤æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥å¾—çŸ¥ï¼Œåœ¨åŒºé—´ $[j, k]$ å†…ï¼Œå¯¹äºæƒ…å†µ 1ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬åªéœ€è¦ç»§ç»­æœç´¢åŒºé—´ $[j+1, k]$ï¼Œè€Œå¯¹äºæƒ…å†µ 2ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä¹Ÿåªéœ€è¦ç»§ç»­æœç´¢åŒºé—´ $[j,k-1]$ æ‰å¯èƒ½ä¼šå‡ºç°ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶çš„ç»“æœã€‚è€Œå¯¹äºæƒ…å†µ 3ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬åªéœ€è¦ç»§ç»­æœç´¢åŒºé—´ $[j+1, k-1]$ã€‚æ— è®ºæ€æ ·ï¼Œç»è¿‡ä¸€æ¬¡è®¡ç®—ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦è€ƒè™‘çš„åˆ—è¡¨é•¿åº¦éƒ½ä¼šå‡å°‘ 1 æˆ– 2ï¼Œè¿™æ„å‘³ç€ twoSum çš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦æ¥åˆ°äº† $\mathcal{O}(n)$ã€‚

content: åŒæŒ‡é’ˆä»£ç  class Solution: def threeSum(self, nums: List[int]) -> List[List[int]]: length = len(nums) nums.sort() res = [] for i in range(0, length - 2): if nums[i] > 0: break if i > 0 and nums[i] == nums[i - 1]: continue target = -nums[i] k = length - 1 j = i + 1 while k > j: if nums[j] + nums[k] > target: k -= 1 elif nums[j] + nums[k] < target: j += 1 else: res.append([nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]]) k -= 1 j += 1 while k > j and nums[k] == nums[k + 1]: k -= 1 while k > j and nums[j] == nums[j - 1]: j += 1 return res æ­¤å¤„ä¾æ—§æœ‰ä¸€äº›ç»†èŠ‚éœ€è¦æ³¨æ„ã€‚å¯¹äº twoSum éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ while å¾ªç¯æ¥ä»£æ›¿ for å¾ªç¯å¯ä»¥æå¤§çš„å‡å°‘è¿è¡Œçš„æ—¶é—´ï¼Œå¯¹äºæœ€å¤–å±‚å¾ªç¯ï¼Œå½“ $nums[i] > 0$ æ—¶ï¼Œæ— è®º $j$ å’Œ $k$ å–ä½•å€¼ï¼Œéƒ½æ— æ³•å¾—åˆ° 0ï¼Œå› æ­¤å¯ä»¥ç›´æ¥ç»“æŸå…¨éƒ¨è®¡ç®—ï¼Œè¿™æ˜¯å› ä¸ºæ•°ç»„å·²ç»ç»è¿‡äº†ä»å¤§åˆ°å°çš„æ’åºã€‚ æ€»ä½“æ¥è¯´ï¼ŒtwoSum éƒ¨åˆ†æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸º $\mathcal{O}(n)$ï¼ŒåµŒå¥—åœ¨å¤–å±‚å¾ªç¯ä¸­ï¼Œæ•´ä½“æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸º $\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ï¼Œè€ƒè™‘åˆ°æ’åºçš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸º $\mathcal{O}(nlogn)$ï¼Œå› æ­¤æ•´ä½“æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¾æ—§ä¸º $\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ã€‚ä¸ hashmap çš„è§£æ³•ç›¸æ¯”ï¼Œè™½ç„¶æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ç›¸åŒï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æ²¡æœ‰äº†æ’é™¤é‡å¤é¡¹åŠ hashmap çš„å½±å“ï¼Œæœ€ç»ˆç»“æœå¾—åˆ°äº†å¾ˆå¥½çš„æå‡ã€‚ æ‰§è¡Œç”¨æ—¶: 436 msï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 99% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ å†…å­˜æ¶ˆè€—: 17.8 MBï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 72% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚

content: æœ€å 1% æ³¨æ„åˆ° $j$ å’Œ $k$ çš„åˆå€¼è®¾ç½®é—®é¢˜ã€‚ç”±äºåˆ—è¡¨æœ‰åºï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å®Œå…¨å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨äºŒåˆ†æŸ¥æ‰¾å‡å°‘åŒæŒ‡é’ˆæœ€åˆæ— ç”¨çš„æŸ¥æ‰¾ã€‚Python å†…ç½®äº† bisect åº“ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨äºŒåˆ†æŸ¥æ‰¾æ–¹ä¾¿çš„ç”Ÿæˆåˆ—è¡¨ä¸­ç›®æ ‡å…ƒç´ çš„ç´¢å¼•ã€‚å¢åŠ äºŒåˆ†æŸ¥æ‰¾åï¼Œä»£ç å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š # Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· k = length - 1 j = i + 1 if nums[j] + nums[k] > target: k = bisect.bisect_right(nums, target - nums[j], j + 1, k) else: j = bisect.bisect_left(nums, target - nums[k], j, k - 1) # Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· æœ€ç»ˆç»“æœï¼š æ‰§è¡Œç”¨æ—¶: 300 msï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 100% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ å†…å­˜æ¶ˆè€—: 17.9 MBï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 53% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ åŒæ ·çš„æ€è·¯ï¼ŒåŒæŒ‡é’ˆ + äºŒåˆ†æŸ¥æ‰¾å¯ä»¥ç”¨åœ¨ LC16 æœ€æ¥è¿‘çš„ä¸‰æ•°ä¹‹å’Œä¸Šã€‚ é—®é¢˜é“¾æ¥ï¼šæœ€æ¥è¿‘çš„ä¸‰æ•°ä¹‹å’Œ é™„ä»£ç ï¼š class Solution: def threeSumClosest(self, nums: List[int], target: int) -> int: res = 10 ** 4 sum = 0 need_ = 0 length = len(nums) if length == 3: return nums[0] + nums[1] + nums[2] nums.sort() for i in range(length - 2): need = target - nums[i] if i > 0 and nums[i] == nums[i - 1]: continue if target > 0 and need <= 0: if abs(res - target) > abs(nums[i] + nums[i + 1] + nums[i + 2] - target): res = nums[i] + nums[i + 1] + nums[i + 2] break j = i + 1 k = length - 1 if nums[j] + nums[k] > need: k = bisect.bisect_right(nums, need - nums[j], i + 2, k) else: j = bisect.bisect_left(nums, need - nums[k], i + 1, k - 1) - 1 while j < k: sum = nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] if abs(res - target) > abs(sum - target): res = sum need_ = nums[j] + nums[k] if need_ > need: k -= 1 while j < k and nums[k] == nums[k + 1]: k -= 1 elif need_ < need: j += 1 while j < k and nums[j] == nums[j - 1]: j += 1 else: return target return res æ‰§è¡Œç”¨æ—¶: 32 msï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 100% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ å†…å­˜æ¶ˆè€—: 15.2 MBï¼Œè¶…è¿‡äº† 14% çš„ Python æäº¤è®°å½•ã€‚ æœ€åï¼Œ100% çœŸå¥½çœ‹ã€‚ğŸ˜

content: ä»£ç  class Solution: def maxArea(self, height: List[int]) -> int: maxS = 0 for r in range(1, len(height)): for l in range(0, len(height)): maxS = max(maxS, (r - l) * min(height[r], height[l])) return maxS ç®€å•åŒå¾ªç¯ä»£ç ï¼Œæ²¡æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆå¯è§£é‡Šçš„ã€‚ ç„¶è€Œå¯¹äºä¸€é“ä¸­ç­‰éš¾åº¦çš„é¢˜æ¥è¯´ï¼Œè¿™ç§è§£æ³•å®åœ¨æ˜¯æœ‰äº›ä¸èƒ½ä»¤äººæ»¡æ„ã€‚å®é™…ä¸Šè¿™æ®µä»£ç è¿è¡Œåä¼šè¶…æ—¶ï¼ŒTime Limit Exceededï¼Œå–œé—»ä¹è§çš„ TLEã€‚ å½“ç„¶ï¼Œæˆ‘ä¸ä¼šè¿™ä¹ˆç®€å•å°±æ”¾å¼ƒï¼ˆè¿™ä¹ˆç®€å•çš„ç®—æ³•è¿˜æ˜¯æ—©ç‚¹æ”¾å¼ƒå¾—äº†ï¼‰ã€‚å°†è¯­è¨€æ¢æˆ C åï¼Œä»£ç å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š int maxArea(int* height, int heightSize){ int maxS = 0; for (int r = 1; r < heightSize; r++) { bool Higher = false; int Highest = height[0]; for (int l = 0; l < heightSize; l++) { if (height[l] <= height[r]) { if (height[l] >= Highest) { maxS = fmax(maxS, (r - l) * fmin(height[l], height[r])); Highest = height[l]; } } else { if (!Higher) { maxS = fmax(maxS, (r - l) * fmin(height[l], height[r])); Higher = true; } } } } return maxS; } ä»£ç ä¼˜åŒ–ã€‚ ç›¸è¾ƒäº Python çš„ä»£ç ï¼Œè¿™é‡Œåˆè¿›è¡Œäº†ä¸€äº›ä¼˜åŒ–ã€‚æ³¨æ„åˆ°åœ¨å†…å¾ªç¯ï¼ˆä¹Ÿå³ $l$ å¾ªç¯ï¼‰çš„è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œ$l$ å€¼ä¸æ–­å˜å¤§ï¼Œæ„å‘³ç€å…¬å¼ä¸­ $(r - l)$ çš„éƒ¨åˆ†ä¼šä¸æ–­å˜å°ã€‚è¿™é‡Œåˆ†ä¸ºä¸¤ä¸ªæƒ…å†µï¼š $height[l]$ æ¯” $height[r]$ æ›´ä½ï¼š æ­¤æ—¶å®¹å™¨çš„ç››æ°´é‡ç”± $height[l]$ å†³å®šè€Œä¸æ˜¯ $height[r]$ ã€‚å½“ $(r - l)$ ä¸æ–­å˜å°ï¼Œè¿™æ„å‘³ç€æˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦æ‰¾åˆ°æ›´å¤§çš„ $height[l]$ æ‰æœ‰å¯èƒ½è®¡ç®—å¤„æ›´å¤§çš„ç››æ°´é‡ $S$ã€‚å› æ­¤åœ¨å†…å¾ªç¯è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œè®°å½•æ‰€ç¢°åˆ°çš„ $height[l]$ çš„æœ€å¤§å€¼ï¼Œä»…å½“å½“å‰ $height[l]$ å€¼æ¯”å†å²æœ€å¤§å€¼å¤§æ—¶ï¼Œæ‰è¿›è¡Œç››æ°´é‡çš„è®¡ç®—ï¼Œå¦åˆ™ç›´æ¥è·³è¿‡è¿™æ¬¡å¾ªç¯ã€‚ $height[l]$ æ¯” $height[r]$ é«˜ï¼š æ­¤æ—¶å®¹å™¨çš„ç››æ°´é‡ç”± $height[r]$ å†³å®šï¼Œåœ¨å†…å¾ªç¯è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œå½“ $l$ ä¸æ–­å˜å¤§ï¼Œå³ $(r - l)$ ä¸æ–­å˜å°ï¼Œç››æ°´é‡ $S$ å¿…å®šä¸ºä¸æ–­å‡å°‘ã€‚å› æ­¤å½“ $height[l] > height[r]$ æ—¶ï¼Œä¸€æ¬¡å†…å¾ªç¯ä»…éœ€è¦è®¡ç®—ç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡çš„ç››æ°´é‡ï¼Œå› ä¸ºç¬¬äºŒæ¬¡ã€ç¬¬ä¸‰æ¬¡ç­‰ä»¥åæ¬¡æ•°çš„ç››æ°´é‡å¿…å®šå°äºç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡çš„ç››æ°´é‡ã€‚ åœ¨è¿™æ ·çš„ä¼˜åŒ–æ¡ä»¶ä¸‹ï¼Œä»£ç ä¾æ—§ç¢°ä¸Šäº†å–œé—»ä¹è§çš„ TLEã€‚äº‹å®è¯æ˜ $\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ çš„ç®—æ³•åœ¨è¿™ç§æ‹™åŠ£çš„ä¼˜åŒ–ä¸‹æ²¡æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆç”¨å¤„ï¼Œè¯¥ $\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ è¿˜æ˜¯ $\mathcal{O}(n^2)$ã€‚

content: æ¨¡å‹å®ç° ä»£ç ä»“åº“ï¼šDL_PM_Predï¼Œå…¬å¼å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š ConvLSTM $$ I_{t} = Sigmoid(Conv(X_t, W_{xi}) + Conv(H_{t-1}, W_{hi}) + b_i) \\ F_{t} = Sigmoid(Conv(X_t, W_{xf}) + Conv(H_{t-1}, W_{hf}) + b_f) \\ O_{t} = Sigmoid(Conv(X_t, W_{xo}) + Conv(H_{t-1}, W_{ho}) + b_o) \\ \tilde{C_t} = Tanh(Conv(X_t, W*{xc}) + Conv(H_{t-1}, W_{hc}) + b_h) \\ C_t = F_t \odot C_{t-1} + I_t \odot \tilde{C_t} \\ H_t = O_t \odot Tanh(C_t)\\ Pred = ReLU(Conv(X_t, W*{xx}) + Conv(H_t, W_{xh}) + b_{p}) \\ $$ ConvGRU $$ R_{t} = Sigmoid(Conv(X_t, W_{xr}) + Conv(H_{t-1}, W_{hr})+b_r) \\ Z_{t} = Sigmoid(Conv(X_t, W_{xz}) + Conv(H_{t-1}, W_{hz})+b_z) \\ \tilde{H_t} = Tanh(Conv(X_t, W*{xh})+Conv(R_t \odot H_{t-1}, W_{rh}) + b_{h}) \\ H_t = Z_t \odot H_{t-1} + (1 - Z_t) \odot \tilde{H} \\ Pred = ReLU(Conv(X_t, W_{xx}) + Conv(H_t, W_{xh}) + b_{p}) \\ $$
